page.title: 02St.Martin's, Stoke Golding
page.content: St.Martin's Roman Catholic High School at Stoke Golding is about 3 miles from Hinckley and 7 miles from Nuneaton.It is run by Dominican Nuns,although there are only 2 at the school now. Their convent is adjacent to the school and at the moment there are 8 sisters living there.The Head Mistress since 1962 has been Sr.Louis Bertrand. There are 307 pupils at the school aged 11-14.There are 16 full time staff and 3 part-time staff.The sisters own 24 acres of land,which includes the school grounds.120 pupils come from Hinckley,the others coming from a radius of 10 miles.252 pupils come by bus,the rest either by car,or bicycle.The local children walk.
